SEARCH
Module java.base
Package java.lang.template

Class FormatterPolicy

java.lang.Object
java.lang.template.FormatterPolicy
All Implemented Interfaces:
PolicyLinkagePREVIEW, SimplePolicyPREVIEW<String>, StringPolicyPREVIEW, TemplatePolicyPREVIEW<String,RuntimeException>
public final class FormatterPolicy extends Object implements StringPolicyPREVIEW, PolicyLinkagePREVIEW
FormatterPolicy is a preview API of the Java platform.
Programs can only use FormatterPolicy when preview features are enabled.
Preview features may be removed in a future release, or upgraded to permanent features of the Java platform.
This TemplatePolicyPREVIEW constructs a String result using Formatter. Unlike Formatter, FormatterPolicy locates values in embedded expressions that follow immediately after the format specifier. TemplatedString expressions without a preceeding specifier, use "%s" by default. Example: 
int x = 10;
int y = 20;
String result = FMT."%05d\{x} + %05d\{y} = %05d\{x + y}";
result is: 00010 + 00020 = 00030
Implementation Requirements:
Since, values are in situ, argument indexing is unsupported.
Implementation Note:
When used in conjunction with a compiler generated TemplatedStringPREVIEW this TemplatePolicyPREVIEW will use the format specifiers in the fragments and types of the values in the value list to produce a more performant formatter.
Since:
20
